title: [Large-scale] Mathematics Problem-Solving Competency Enhancement Course Utilizing Blended Learning and Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and application to workplace tasks
context.additional_context: Establishment of real-time interactive and self-directed learning environments using mobile devices, with structural design to enhance learner autonomy in flipped and blended learning models.

learning_goals: Learners can independently organize math concepts at least three times a week using pre-learning materials in a flipped learning environment.
Learners can mathematically model real-world workplace problems through online-offline integrated activities in a blended learning model.
Learners can present problem-solving solutions with over 80% completeness in project-based assessments using peer evaluation and feedback systems.
Learners can record learning logs at least twice a week using digital learning tools and analyze self-directed learning patterns.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
